session.name: Liberty Index 2022 - U.S. House
session.description: Created by the Republican Liberty Caucus, the 2022 Liberty Index is a liberty-focused legislative scorecard for the U.S. House. The Liberty Index scores Republican members of Congress on 20 pivotal bills/votes from 2022 that either advance liberty or diminish liberty.

bills.title: The Freedom to Vote: John R
bills.description: The Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act, which would have federalized elections, removing local control and cancelling many state election laws that are crucial for election integrity.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 220-203 on 1/13/22, Cloture Motion in Senate failed to obtain the required 60 votes, with a 49-51 vote on 1/19/22

bills.title: The United States Innovation and Competition Act, which appropriated $250 billion for wasteful and unnecessary spending
bills.description: The United States Innovation and Competition Act, which appropriated $250 billion for wasteful and unnecessary spending. The bill was nearly 3,000 pages long and allocated tax dollars towards subsidizing semiconductors, new federal grant programs, foreign aid, environmentalist programs, and a slush fund for labor unions.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 222-210 on 2/4/22, Cloture Motion Passed Senate 68-28 on 3/28/22. Each chamber passed a different version, so the bill was not transmitted to the President

bills.title: The Postal Service Reform Act, which appropriated an additional $58 billion to the United States Postal Service
bills.description: The Postal Service Reform Act, which appropriated an additional $58 billion to the United States Postal Service.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 342-92 on 2/8/22, Passed Senate 79-19 on 3/8/22, Signed by President

bills.title: The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2022, a $1
bills.description: The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2022, a $1.5 trillion omnibus spending bill that was 2,741 pages long.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 260-171 on 3/9/22, Passed Senate 68-31 on 3/10/22, Signed by President

bills.bill_number: H.R.7108 were removed in the Senate).
bills.title: The Suspending Normal Trade Relations with Russia and Belarus Act, which gives the President unbridled authority to sanction virtually anyone, anywhere in the world
bills.description: The Suspending Normal Trade Relations with Russia and Belarus Act, which gives the President unbridled authority to sanction virtually anyone, anywhere in the world. It would also impose tariff increases on goods from Russia/Belarus. (Passed House 424-8 on 3/17/22. At Sen. Rand Paul's request, the controversial portions of the bill The Restaurant Revitalization Fund Replenishment Act, which would have appropriated over $60 billion for corporate welfare.

bills.title: The Restaurant Revitalization Fund Replenishment Act, which would have appropriated over $60 billion for corporate welfare
bills.description: The Restaurant Revitalization Fund Replenishment Act, which would have appropriated over $60 billion for corporate welfare.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 223-203 on 4/7/22, but failed to advance in the Senate

bills.title: The Additional Ukraine Supplemental Appropriations Act, which appropriated over $40 billion in foreign aid to Ukraine
bills.description: The Additional Ukraine Supplemental Appropriations Act, which appropriated over $40 billion in foreign aid to Ukraine.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 368-57 on 5/10/22, Passed Senate 86-11 on 5/19/22, Signed by President

bills.title: The Domestic Terrorism Prevention Act, which would have expanded the federal government by creating new domestic terrorism offices in the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Justice and
bills.description: The Domestic Terrorism Prevention Act, which would have expanded the federal government by creating new domestic terrorism offices in the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Justice and the FBI. (Passed House 222-203 on 5/18/22, Cloture Motion in Senate failed to obtain the required 60 votes, with a 47-47 vote The Protecting Our Kids Act, which prohibits adults under 21 from buying semi-automatic rifles or high capacity magazines. It also bans bump stocks and "ghost guns."

bills.title: The Protecting Our Kids Act, which prohibits adults under 21 from buying semi-automatic rifles or high capacity magazines
bills.description: The Protecting Our Kids Act, which prohibits adults under 21 from buying semi-automatic rifles or high capacity magazines. It also bans bump stocks and "ghost guns."
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 223-204 on 6/8/22, but failed to advance in the Senate

bills.title: The Federal Extreme Risk Protection Order Act, which imposes unconstitutional Red Flag laws, allowing federal courts to revoke a person's 2nd Amendment right and order the seizure of their firearms wi
bills.description: The Federal Extreme Risk Protection Order Act, which imposes unconstitutional Red Flag laws, allowing federal courts to revoke a person's 2nd Amendment right and order the seizure of their firearms without due process.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 224-202 on 6/9/22, but failed to advance in the Senate

bills.title: The ARPA–H Act, which would have created a new agency within the Department of Health and Human Services, called the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Health
bills.description: The ARPA–H Act, which would have created a new agency within the Department of Health and Human Services, called the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Health. This wasteful new bureaucracy would cost taxpayers $500 million every year.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 336-85 on 6/22/22, but failed to advance in the Senate

bills.title: The Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, which imposed new background check requirements on firearm transfers and sent federal funds to states that enact unconstitutional Red Flag laws
bills.description: The Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, which imposed new background check requirements on firearm transfers and sent federal funds to states that enact unconstitutional Red Flag laws.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 234-193 on 6/24/22, Cloture Motion in Senate passed 65-34 on 6/23/22, Signed by President

bills.title: The first version of the National Defense Authorization Act of 2023, which would have appropriated $839 billion for the 2023 military budget, without auditing the Pentagon and without repealing the CO
bills.description: The first version of the National Defense Authorization Act of 2023, which would have appropriated $839 billion for the 2023 military budget, without auditing the Pentagon and without repealing the COVID-19 vaccine mandate on military servicemembers.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 329-101 on 7/14/22, but failed to advance in the Senate. This bill was later replaced with H.R.7776

bills.title: The Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, which would have appropriated $400 billion to fund multiple departments of the federal government, enacting
bills.description: The Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, which would have appropriated $400 billion to fund multiple departments of the federal government, enacting a $50 billion increase from the previous year.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 220-207 on 7/20/22, but failed to advance in the Senate

bills.title: The Chips and Science Act, which appropriated over $76 billion in corporate welfare to the semiconductor industry
bills.description: The Chips and Science Act, which appropriated over $76 billion in corporate welfare to the semiconductor industry. (Passed House 243-187 on 7/28/22, Cloture Motion in Senate Passed 64-32 on 7/26/22, Signed by President).

bills.title: The Assault Weapons Ban of 2022, which would have banned the sale, possession and transfer of semi-automatic rifles, high capacity magazines and other firearm accessories
bills.description: The Assault Weapons Ban of 2022, which would have banned the sale, possession and transfer of semi-automatic rifles, high capacity magazines and other firearm accessories.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 217-213 on 7/29/22, but failed to advance in the Senate

bills.title: The Inflation Reduction Act, which imposed new taxes on businesses, created 87,000 new IRS agents, and appropriated over $400 billion for wasteful spending
bills.description: The Inflation Reduction Act, which imposed new taxes on businesses, created 87,000 new IRS agents, and appropriated over $400 billion for wasteful spending.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 220-207 on 8/12/22, Passed Senate 51-50 on 8/7/22, Signed by President

bills.title: The Continuing Appropriations and Ukraine Supplemental Approprations Act, which funded the federal government through 12/16/22 while sending an additional $12 billion in foreign aid to Ukraine
bills.description: The Continuing Appropriations and Ukraine Supplemental Approprations Act, which funded the federal government through 12/16/22 while sending an additional $12 billion in foreign aid to Ukraine.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 230-201 on 9/30/22, Cloture Motion in Senate passed 72-23 on 9/27/22, Signed by President

bills.title: The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023, which approves an $858 billion military budget without an audit
bills.description: The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023, which approves an $858 billion military budget without an audit. This wasteful Pentagon budget enacts an 8% spending increase, appropriating $45 billion more than what President Biden requested.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 350-80 on 12/8/22, Passed Senate 83-11 on 12/15/22, Signed by President

bills.title: The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2023, a $1
bills.description: The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2023, a $1.7 trillion omnibus bill that was 4,155 pages long.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 225-201 on 12/23/22, Passed Senate 68-29 on 12/22/22, Signed by President
